proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: BO, CO, pi * (80 / 180) = Arc(AOC), ∠OCB, ∠BOC, Arc(AOC), Arc(EOA), ∠GCO, BC, 3.14 = pi, ∠GBO, C on ⊙(O, radius_O), pi * (25 / 180) = ∠GBF, ∠CBO, ∠CBO, G on BC, ∠COE, ∠EOA, B on ⊙(O, radius_O), ∠FOC, ∠AOC, ∠BCO, F on BO

Step 2:
Theorem: Arc Measure equals Angle Measure
Premises : Arc(AOC)
Conclusions: ∠AOC = Arc(AOC)

Step 3:
Theorem: Arc Measure equals Angle Measure
Premises : Arc(EOA)
Conclusions: ∠EOA = Arc(EOA)

Step 4:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠GCO
Conclusions: ∠GCO = 2 * pi - ∠OCG

Step 5:
Theorem: Definition of Triangle
Premises : BO, BC, CO
Conclusions: △BCO

Step 6:
Theorem: Point On Circle Def
Premises : C on ⊙(O, radius_O)
Conclusions: radius_O = CO

Step 7:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠CBO
Conclusions: ∠CBO = 2 * pi - ∠OBC

Step 8:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠CBO, G on BC
Conclusions: ∠CBO = ∠GBO

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠OCB, G on BC
Conclusions: ∠OCB = ∠OCG

Step 10:
Theorem: Point On Circle Def
Premises : B on ⊙(O, radius_O)
Conclusions: radius_O = BO

Step 11:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠COE, ∠FOC
Conclusions: pi = ∠COE + ∠FOC

Step 12:
Theorem: Circumference splited
Premises : ∠COE, ∠EOA, ∠AOC
Conclusions: 2 * pi = ∠AOC + ∠COE + ∠EOA

Step 13:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : ∠BCO, G on BC
Conclusions: ∠BCO = ∠GCO

Step 14:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on BO, ∠BOC
Conclusions: ∠BOC = ∠FOC

Step 15:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on BO, ∠GBO
Conclusions: ∠GBF = ∠GBO

Step 16:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * (80 / 180) = Arc(AOC), ∠AOC = Arc(AOC)
Conclusions: pi * (80 / 180) = ∠AOC

Step 17:
Theorem: Interior Angle Sum Theorem for Triangle(O, C, B)
Premises : △BCO
Conclusions: pi = ∠BOC + ∠CBO + ∠OCB

Step 18:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : radius_O = CO, radius_O = BO
Conclusions: BO = CO

Step 19:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠GBF = ∠GBO, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠GBF
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = ∠GBO

Step 20:
Theorem: Issoceles Triangle Property
Premises : △BCO, BO = CO
Conclusions: ∠BCO = ∠OBC, ∠CBO = ∠OCB

Step 21:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CBO = ∠GBO, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠GBO
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = ∠CBO

Step 22:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠CBO
Conclusions: 0.44 = ∠CBO

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠CBO = 2 * pi - ∠OBC, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠CBO
Conclusions: pi * (25 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠OBC

Step 24:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : ∠BOC = ∠FOC, 3.14 = pi, ∠OCB = ∠OCG, pi * (25 / 180) = ∠CBO, pi = ∠BOC + ∠CBO + ∠OCB
Conclusions: 3.14 = 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠FOC + ∠OCG

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠OCB = ∠OCG, ∠CBO = ∠OCB, 0.44 = ∠CBO
Conclusions: 0.44 = ∠OCG

Step 26:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : pi * (25 / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠OBC, 3.14 = pi
Conclusions: 5.85 = ∠OBC

Step 27:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BCO = ∠OBC, ∠BCO = ∠GCO, 5.85 = ∠OBC
Conclusions: 5.85 = ∠GCO

Step 28:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 5.85 = ∠GCO, ∠GCO = 2 * pi - ∠OCG
Conclusions: 5.85 = 2 * pi - ∠OCG

Step 29:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 0.44 = ∠OCG, 5.85 = 2 * pi - ∠OCG, pi * (80 / 180) = ∠AOC, 2 * pi = ∠AOC + ∠COE + ∠EOA, pi = ∠COE + ∠FOC, 3.14 = 3.14 * (25 / 180) + ∠FOC + ∠OCG
Conclusions: 4.01 = ∠EOA

Step 30:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 4.01 = ∠EOA, ∠EOA = Arc(EOA)
Conclusions: 4.01 = Arc(EOA)
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(MeasureOf(Arc(A, O, C)), MeasureOf(Arc(D, O, B)))
